subject: Re: [junit] reg. JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi Pallavi, Here is the sample program to add subtract and multiply two numbers. The test case written in Junit is attached below. ... public class
messageBody:
Hi Pallavi,
Here is the sample program to add subtract and multiply two numbers. The
test case written in Junit is attached below.

----------------------------------
public class AirthmaticOperation {

public void AirthmaticOperation(){
}

public int Addition(int x, int y) {
int z=0;
z=x+y;
return z;
}

public int Subtraction(int x, int y) {
int z=0;
z=x-y;
return z;
}

public int Multiplication(int x, int y) {
int z=0;
z=x*y;
return z;
}
}
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

The test case for the above program in junit is :
-------------------------------------------------
import junit.framework.*;

public class ArithmaticTestCase extends TestCase {

AirthmaticOperation arithmaticoperation=null;

public ArithmaticTestCase(String s) {
super(s);
}

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new ArithmaticTestCase("testAdd"));
suite.addTest(new ArithmaticTestCase("testSub"));
suite.addTest(new ArithmaticTestCase("testMul"));
return suite;

}
public void testAdd() {
AirthmaticOperation arithmaticoperation = new AirthmaticOperation();
assertTrue(arithmaticoperation.Addition(3,4) == 7);
}

public void testSub() {
AirthmaticOperation arithmaticoperation = new AirthmaticOperation();
assertTrue(arithmaticoperation.Subtraction(6,4) == 2);
}

public void testMul() {
AirthmaticOperation arithmaticoperation = new AirthmaticOperation();
assertTrue(arithmaticoperation.Multiplication(3,4) == 12);
}
}

-------------------------------------------------

hope this helps
regards
Manjunath

----- Original Message -----
From: "pallavi metla" <pallavi28183@...>
To: <junit@...>
Sent: Friday, September 12, 2003 9:35 AM
Subject: [junit] reg. JUnit


> Hi everybody,
>
> As a part of my Masters, I am supposed to learn JUnit. I went through some
of the basic papers as JUnit Test Infected, junit cook book etc. but am not
understanding the correct use of that.
>
> Like if I create a simple program like addition of two integers and want
to pass the values of a and b to be some (i.e., generating the test cases),
how can I do using the JUnit. I created a JUnit program "TestAddInt.java
"with a testAdd() method in that compared the resultant value of a and b
with the expected value but its something like I took the values a and b as
ints..TestAddInt.java but am not understanding how to bring the values of
the original java program "AddInt.java"??
>
> I am pretty sure that if someone give a simple example, I will learn the
rest. So I would be thankful if someone helps me out.
>
> Regards,
> Pallavi
